caption: (Translated by Google) This chingon the place good attention if I fly again  (Original) Esta chingon el lugar buena atencion si vuelo otra ves

My friends and I had a birthday celebration here and we weren’t really impressed. There were definitely some positives to the night, but there were also some negatives.  I feel like it’s only fair to start with the positives. First of all, the view from the rooftop is incredible. You get two different views, one of FiDi and one of Midtown/Hudson Yards. I’d suggest going before the sunset so you can see the transition from day to night - it’s really cool. Another positive is that their beer is fantastic. It’s a little expensive, and the pitchers are really small, but the beer is truly awesome!  I guess the glaring negative is that the service was not very good. They were completely swamped and we had to wait forever for drinks, food, the check, etc. They also double charged me for the tip which is my mistake. Lastly, the menu online and the in person menu don’t match. The prices are different and the correct menu is reflected in my pictures.  I’d be willing to give them another shot, but I was a little bit turned off after my first visit. I do also understand that COVID has not made it easy for restaurants by any means.
The people here are clowns. If you don’t avoid enter at your own risk.  Not a friendly face in sight

It's been a while, and it's a beer house I went to while visiting Dumbo in Brooklyn when I traveled to NYC in January before Covid. I think I drank about 6 or 7 glasses of Indian Pale Ale with my friend. I really enjoyed the dark ale of 10 degrees or more the most, and the way I pour the beer myself was really cool. I love the ambience as well!
Good drinks. Food a little expensive for the amount of food you get. I had the breakfast nachos and it was ok.
Great views of the city!
The rooftop lounge is breathtaking and the service and fare is top notch, as always.

Hopefully this review will help offset the last guy that gave a 1 star review basically because he was asked to wear a mask!  This place is a great neighborhood bar with an awesome beer list, good food, reasonable prices, and friendly staff.  Happy they're able to continue operating during these times and I'll be stopping by again soon!

I stopped by that place w my friend. We wanted to make a large purchase of beer for our home party. The first red flag was when the cashier asked me to put my face mask on immediately. There is no problem with that but he sounded extremely rude. I apologized and put the mask on. After that, I asked him for a beer sample, he brought it to us, my friend and I didn’t like it. We asked him for a recommendation. He recommended another beer and we kindly asked him to try that one and... We got the nastiest attitude ever. He asked me if I did realize how far he had to walk to bring us the first sample? I apologized to him. He said -“it’s fine, I’ll bring it to you”. However, we decided to leave. Honestly, I got shocked by his behavior. We wanted to support a local business during these harsh times by making a purchase there, but apparently they are doing just fine even tho the place was empty in a middle of sunny Saturday. I didn’t catch his name but it was tall Caucasian guy with blond hair in his 40s. I Will never go to that place again.

Great decor, super friendly staff, fun games to play, a wide variety of delicious beers, cool self service system.  All in all, an awesome bar! The best way possible to end our trip to NY!  10/10 will definitely visit again!
Came in on a Monday Around lunch. Wasn’t too busy. Service was prompt. Beer was OK. Would have been a nice place to get some work done since it was fairly quiet.
(Translated by Google) Good attention  (Original) Buena atención
Food is trash

Fun brewery with an innovative concept to get you involved a bit more. Plenty of different beers (probably close to 20) that you can pour from the tap yourself and do your own taste testing. Definitely worth a visit.
Really really good beer just on the Brooklyn side of the bridge. Being from WI my wife and I were looking for a place in NYC just like this. Highly Recommend
Pour your own, delicious, brewed on site beers!
House beers are pretty average but they do have some nice guest taps (check the menu on Untappd). There’s a self-pour system if you want to sample a bunch of beers.

Great place with delicious beers. The bartender did an awesome job and she always be made sure we had a full beer.  Didn't order any food but hope to come back and try some time. They also have a cool self serve tap area!
This is my SPOT. Great food, amazing beer selection, and genuine staff. Love this place!
Went recently after work and had a great time - fantastic beers brewed on site. Great, eclectic bar menu and pour-your-own draft beers.
Just when I thought Randolph DUMBO couldn’t get better, they get arcade games!
Self pour beer joint with a lively crowd.
Self pour beer is an awesome idea! First time being ID’d for years 🤣
Fun place with good beer I love the self service thing.
Bar games and killer craft beer, this place rules!
Love all the Randolphs but DUMBO is by far my favorite. Great for after work or weekend brunch!
(Translated by Google) House beers, great local and 10 staff  (Original) Cervezas de la casa, gran local y personal de 10

(Translated by Google) Funky bar located in DUMBO, one of NYC's coolest areas. There I had one of the most delicious beers I have ever tasted in my life: COFFEE CREAM ALE. Be sure to try this beer when you visit the place!  When I mentioned to the bartender how much I liked the beer, he made sure to call the person in charge of it who thanked me for the compliment.  (Original) Bar descolado localizado em DUMBO, uma das áreas mais legais de NYC. Lá eu tomei uma das cervejas mais deliciosas que já provei em toda a minha vida: a COFFEE CREAM ALE. Não deixem de experimentar essa cerveja quando visitarem o local!  Quando mencionei ao barman o quanto tinha gostado da cerveja, ele fez questão de chamar o responsável por ela que me agradeceu pelo elogio.

I loved Randolph cocktails on broome more than I care to admit. But Randolph beer in dumbo fills the hole in my heart with delicious beers, amazing pretzels, awesome bartenders, and a gorgeous space. Also skeeball and shuffleboard. Hot damn. Love this location.
Favorite place in DUMBO to go with a group of friends or to just drink great beer alone .  Matt the bartender always strikes up good convo.  He’s like a young Sam Malone!!!  Best spot in DUMBO

We were lucky enough to arrive there during happy hour so enjoyed some delicious cheap beers and some yummy snacks. Looking forward to getting there another time when I can pour my own beer from an impressive selection.

Beer lovers, rejoice. Dumbo has a self-pour by the ounce destination.  You may not have anyone greet you or explain their beer system to you, so I have to knock off a star. Just walk to the back, take a look at the instructions on the wall and ask the bartender to get a card. There's a pretty decent range of brews, leaning heavily into the sours (As of October '19). A great place for after work, or if you're looking to try a bunch of different beers on the cheap.

If you're parched and/or anywhere remotely near dumbo, get yourself to Randolph. The food is really good and they have great vegan options (cauliflower wings with vegan ranch! 🤯), but your burger-loving friends will be happy too (i.e. good for a mixed crowd). Veg and gluten free stuff is all marked on the menu (can every place do that?). The bartenders and servers are also super nice--none of that frantic and agro Manhattan bar scene energy, even on the weekends. Bonus: shuffleboard table!

Hip spot. Self serve beers, shuffleboard, foosball, outdoor seating, and an overall large space. Plenty of beers to choose from as well as spirits. Happy hour is Mon thru Fri 4pm to 7pm. They've got free wifi and table specials. Has an upscale feel to it but is not overbearing.
No cash accepted and no CC issued in a foreign country, too bad 👎
Good place to stop for a beer after walking the bridge. Note is card only, no cash. Good selection of interesting brews.
Awesome place. Good vibe, and the steak sandwich is outstanding.
Excellent brunch, do not sleep on the brunch punch!
Cool spot for bar food and beers 🍻
Cheese burger is an A. Beer is good. Cool spot. Great staff. Really nice time there today.
Great food and fast service! Their fries are the absolute best 🤤 full service bar with bar games and plenty of seating + couches and cool atmosphere lighting!

Decent food but over priced, $19 plus tax and tip for cheeseburger... beer and food are good but pricing does not match food quality or experience. We went in a few weeks ago, $100 lunch for basic bar food is ridiculous for 3 burgers and 3 basic drinks- given the service it was way too much.  Went in around 12:45 were told we could only order from dinner menu, so limited meal options. They didn't really have table service in the upper area. You order at the bar, if you don't sit at the bar the kitchen staff, an expediter, delivers the food. If you're there long enough someone from the back will come with water, but there isn't a waiter- it was strange I was unsure if you're supposed to tip, I covered the bill and left a typical tip amount as it was $90 without the tip to put a few bucks more didn't really matter.  In general I would not return for food.
Nice place i was there for friends bday party great environment. I’ll love this beer thing
Awesome Beer selection, great vibe. The serve your own system is a bit confusing at first but easily becomes the best invention since sliced bread.
After coming here many times. I came with a dog and sat outside and was told to leave. It was an outdoor seating with multiple other dogs. Won't be coming back

After a long walk over the Brooklyn Bridge, stopping for a refreshing beer and delicious food was a great choice. The service was great and people were very helpful. The wings were amazing delicious. The steak Sandwich was very tasty and packed with flavor. If I am ever in Brooklyn, I will be back @raulvsfood
Great food, fun atmosphere, grab a card and fill up your own beer!

Awesome self-service bar hidden away from the touristy parts of DUMBO. You can pour however much or however little beer you'd like and you're charged by the ounce. Love this place for a chill night out.
Really good for drinks. Not very good at all for food. My chicken was dry. If you don't drink you still have up pay the $30 unlimited drinks if someone else with you gets it
(Translated by Google) The atmosphere is good and there are many kinds of beer. It's expensive. It's expensive.  (Original) 분위기좋고 맥주종류도 많고 음식은 핫윙만 먹어봤지만 맛있었는데 너모너모 비싸요 진짜 너어어어무 비싸요

(Translated by Google) Bah, the place is good and the beer soooo good. But it leaves nothing to be desired in the service. It's him being beer vice, with great styles. But to get the card to serve, it has to be insistent. We'll use it later. The dishes are simple but tasty. Prices? Of new york, of course. It's the tip is for the outside of the card, but if it does not improve on the service I will not leave more. Ha, and the bathrooms are unisex.  (Original) Bah, o lugar é bom e a cerveja Muuuuito Boa. Mas deixa a desejar no serviço. É dele ser vice de cerveja, com ótimos estilos. Mas pra conseguir o cartão pra se servir tem que ser insistente. Depois a gente se serve. Os pratos são simples, mas saborosos. Preços? De nova iorque, claro.  É a gorjeta é por fora do cartão,  mas se não melhorar no serviço não deixo mais. Ha, e os banheiros são unisex.

Great bar with plenty of seating inside and outdoors. There is a wait for food, but the steak skewers, burger, & pretzel we got were delicious. Also a great selection of beer. Unrelated, the bathrooms are very nice - a whole hall of single stalls, no gender required. A+ bathrooms, thank you guys.
Love this place. Great ambiance and service

We keep trying to give this place a chance and it consistently disappoints. We went today for brunch. 60 minutes later no food. In addition to this, the bartender was so rude - so rude. Almost like waiting 60 minutes is our fault. Dumbo needs more restaurants - but only the ones who check service first should come. We will not be back and I hope the bartender figures out it’s not about her, but her customers!
Great beer and atmosphere!

Randolph in Dumbo is an awesome bar at the Brooklyn side of the bridge. With pour your own beer service, you have the chance to try out as many as you want. Prices are really good per ounce, so make sure to ask to try it  out while you're there. They have really good food, try the Mac and cheese or the fish because they are both amazing. Also make sure to go to the bathroom, it will definitely trip you out while you're in there. Would highly recommend going here if you are in Brooklyn.
Great beer great place
Great brunch! Staff was very nice
Very good food and drinks and cool atmosphere

After all the great reviews I was disappointed. Although brunch is served until 5 bottomless ends at 4 . Benedict ... flavorless, fried that came with .. SALTY.  Got the burger , flavoring was so so ... added egg, avocado and bacon $3 each ... got one piece of bacon cut in half.  Overall, in my opinion it was a try and fail !  Wings were BOMB covered in sauce and great . . . Asked if the had blue cheese , sever said she wasnt sure but also never checked when I asked her again.

selfpour beer is amazing, wide variety of beer choices (although some of the beer didn't taste so great), great music (classy old school hip hop when I was there). Not too crowded for a Saturday night. Definitely had a great time with friends when I came here. Would definiely go back to Randolph Beer again, here or another location.
Great staff, awesome food, phenomenal beer
Great beer and food
Amazing place!
Nice selection of beers, fun games, great place to spend a Sunday afternoon!
The service generally sucks and the beers are overpriced for what they are.
Good beer
Delicious food. Real microbrewery with a big delicious selection. Games. What more do you need for a fun hangout?

Cool scene with plenty of beers.  Food however was bad, the fault of an uninspired menu.  Chicken sandwich was beyond dry (shake shacks is much better), buffalo cauliflower wasn't breaded and fried but steamed perhaps and basted served with bland ranch dressing.  Go for the scene and space as well as beers but avoid the food.
Really a 4.5 .Cool place ... A little expensive but great place to meet friends. No tv's though
Pretzel is amazing...also super fun place to bring kids during the early hours...skeeball, foosball, shuffleboard and pinball are all free...also love the beer card to try a ton of beers..
Great vibe with some great beers they make on the spot.
Fun place with great beer
Great selection of beers. You pour your own.
Nice spot ... we only had beers at the bar, standard offerings ... nice big spot with games and and people having a good time
Nice!!!😁
A real pity they only accept cards and no cash. Otherwise not a bad place if you don't mind the subway rattling past every few minutes.
Nice space for a beer with friendly staff. No cash transactions which is a hassle for tourists.

This is the only place I ate at twice on my vacation to New York, because it’s that good. The bartenders were extremely nice and friendly. Drinks were great and decently priced. Their food was really good and the selection of beers was extensive. Definitely loved visiting this place.
Self service option with pay as you go (per oz) games and nice ambience. Highly recommended

(Translated by Google) Really TOP! Great place, lots of beer! NEIPA! That we do not have in Europe ... To eat, play and drink right next to the Brooklyn Bridge.  I highly recommend !!! 😁  (Original) Vraiment TOP ! Super bel endroit, pleins de bières ! Des NEIPA ! Ça on n'a pas en Europe... A manger, jouer et boire juste à côté du pont de Brooklyn.  Je recommande vivement !!! 😁
This place is awesome. You have a variety of different beers to sample and choose from at very decent prices.

The only time I have ever walked out while at a restaurant. We went for brunch. Got there at noon and waited 2 hours without getting our food. The waiter, while nice, kept promising they were making our food when clearly that wasn’t the truth. We ended up leaving to go eat somewhere else. Terrible...
We stumbled upon this place one day when looking for an espresso, which we didn’t find. Instead, i had a very nice coffee beer, very dark and tasty. Hip looking place, service was okay.

They took forever to bring out our food, bacon was veryyyyy well done and dry, our server ordered the wrong drinks for us. The chicken I ordered ( added it to my French toast ) it was so crispy it tasted burnt as well. My friends bacon was undercooked ... just a lot of food issues. The server didn’t come for about 20-30 minutes. The only good thing was our unlimited drinks for brunch. Which is why they get 3 stars and not a 2.
Great beer with an excellent setup. Food is great as well. Definite top hangout spot.
(Translated by Google) Very good but a bit expensive  (Original) Très bien mais un peu cher
The music was way too loud for the number of people in the space, but otherwise a good space. Good beers, and the bartender was friendly, helpful, and knowledgeable
Bottomless Brunch deal is fantastic and the games are free. Love the atmosphere!
Great place to stop by 😊 Good selection of beers and cool music. Stop by !
Large place but they close early on Sunday - Foursquare lists their opening on Sunday until 2am but they close at 9pm - be careful. They have a very large choice of beer
One of the greatest places in NYC!
Randolph's is an excellent brew pub with great beers, great staff, and awesome food. Couldn't recommend this place enough.
Mediocre beer, slow service, loud crowds, and food that falls somewhere between disgusting and mediocre. Save your money and go elsewhere.
Slightly to expensive for the experience and the location.

Very cool place. We walked across the Brooklyn bridge and were hot and thirsty. we found this place in Yelp and if was so cute. Arcade and Bar games inside. They have a patio. They also have couches or you can sit at the bar. This is the first place i have been to we you can pour your own beer. Overall I  really liked it
Exciting beer selection but couldn’t pour myself a drink without getting huge head
Beer selection and ambiance- okay. Appetizers took almost an hour when the bar is not even busy. Just don’t expect timely service.
The place looks great but waited for an hour for an order that never came and ended up leaving the place.
Very good welcoming atmosphere. Variety of seating arrangements. Bar food good. Lively atmosphere and noise level  much more suited for after work get togethers

I have a neutral feeling of the place, though I would lean towards the positive end of things.  Decor/atmosphere was good knowing that it is noisy - fun for people watching, not a place for quiet conversation. Credit cards only which works for me and the self serve beer was an interesting concept.  Beer brewed onsite was hit or miss where my friend's was good and mine was fine but it didn't match the style it was supposed to be.  Bartenders were good, the real downfall was the kitchen.  Both food orders came out majorly wrong and while our bill was adjusted to make up for the errors, the food wasn't that great for what it was.

The beer is overpriced, the list is hit or miss and the house brewed options are the kind of homebrew you might not share with friends, but you'd happily drink it yourself.  That being said, the food is surprisingly decent and the staff has always been great. The place also looks quite nice. A pool table wouldn't hurt, but I get it if that's not the sort of atmosphere they want.  Given the frustrating lack of options in the neighborhood I'd recommend popping over if you're in the area and feel like some food and a beer, but I wouldn't go out of my way.
Trash. Way too expensive for the food, came out after an hour, cold. Service was rude, really bad experience. Will not return

The go-to hangout spot in Dumbo! These guys have great food, an amazing beer selection, space for many many groups, and also outdoor seating.  They are kid friendly as well. I’ve been here a dozen times and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable every time. 5 stars
Too millennial/centennial for my dad's taste 😂😂
Expensive! No cash, Only Credit Cards!!!
(Translated by Google) Craft beer and it wasn't cold  (Original) Cerveza artesanal y no estaba fría
It is a fine place to get a couple beers, kind of noisy place if you are going to talk with friend. Service is kind of slow too,  if you are in a table outside. They need to address that!!

The food at this place was okay except the menu was different than what we got. The real issue was our bartender who was super rude and acted like we were doing him a favor. I definitely do not recommend this place.
Beers are overpriced, and not even very good. The self pour system is a way you can convince yourself of this fact by trying all the beers.

Great ambiance, spacious, fun games and the beers are great. Service was a bit off, though - the bartender was super rude and very cold. Wasn't particularly helpful answering questions about the menu. Would return but don't have high customer service expectations.

I really love the way you can buy beer and pay for it. Take the card from bartender, choose the beer you want, place the card under the device and pour what and you want and how much you want. That's really great! I need a place like this in Warsaw, Poland. We ordered some food to share: hummus plate and a dessert served in a beer mug (really big one!) - both very tasty. It's a very chilled out place (watch the signs at the entrance to the restroom ;) ), you can do what you want. In my opinion that place has one weakness: you can choose from over than 20 kinds of beer but only from few types - mostly porters and ipas which aren't my favourites. I can honestly recommend La Grosse Pomme and sour beers if you like it. Note that beers presented at their webiste are different from those served at the bar.
Great place to meet up with friends and try out a wide variety of beers at your leisure.
Good selection of beers including ones they brew on the premises. The space is also very nice with seating for large groups or smaller private seating.
$14 for a neat Bullet rye at 7pm??? Where am I? Cipriani? I feel i was in a coyote bar not an upscale venue...

Cool setup in an old parking garage... Beer selection is amazing, staff friendly, but this review is for the food... Got recommended to go as it was a "gastropub". Food was very inventive, but executed horribly and didn't even want to finish it. Might have been an off night, will try again if in the area and hungry.
Beer yourself pumps, easy to spend an entire day here working through the 30+ beers
Decent beer selection, but prices are higher than average across the board. This isn't a place for the beer connoisseur, but rather tourists and others unbothered with paying $10+ for a beer.

Very nice spot for happy hour or a night cap....food is great and good beer selection....even more impressively is that this bar is on the second floor and it is wheel chair accessible with a handy wheelchair lift/elevator....something you don't see enough of
Dont missunderstand this rating. Food is good and selection of beers is good. Lunch time wait for food isnt though.
Nice food and great selection of beers.
I really loved it, a great experience for me and my friend
Great concept but watch your spending. It's very easy to just keep pouring.
Great variety of beers.  Great pretzels. Sliders were delicious.  I loved this place.
Great place! Good beer selection and food. Great vibe. The Randolph’s Pale Ale was delicious.

Unique spot in the area that’s fun and relaxing. Not pretentious. Big beer selection. The food is nice bar food with more healthy options than normal. Music was a touch too loud and table service was mediocre so knocking a star for that but will def return.
Great for lunch in Brooklyn. Great menu of brunch and beer to pair it with
Very cool place and the self pouring beer stations is a great idea. Looking forward to a 2nd visit when I return to NYC.
Good spot, lots of beers on tap and can pour small amounts do can drink a wide variety. Food was also excellent.
Food is good. Beer is solid but not exceptional. Expect to pay a mint.

This is a fun spot that we just happened upon heading to another restaurant. We didn't eat or drink, but the staff was beyond friendly and walked us through the menu which looks comfort driven and reasonably priced. The guy behind the bar was super nice and we look forward to heading back there.  It looks like a great spot for brunch with the kids. There's lots of games and the space is loud which means your children will fit right in.

Really great place to grab a beer/food and chill with friends. The wall taps have a great variety of well-priced beers and the staff is helpful. Lots of seating, some overlooking the brewery machines. Foosball, shuffleboard and pinball machine were fun! Make sure to go to the bathroom at the end of the hall

Brooklyn's best place to chillax! Lots of great food, self-service beer taps, full bar, great sound system playing awesome music, and perfect kitchen menu with the best waffle fries. Couches, benches, tables, stools! Vintage pinball and table shuffleboard.

Pour your own craft beer joint w/ an upscale setting and vibe. Over 20+ beers to choice from - and you get decide how much to pour - as you're changed by the oz. Hang w/ hipsters, locals and skilled craftspeople. The shrimp tacos were the best, skip the calamari. Empanadas were pretty good too.

Great place for casual drinks or to grab quick, delicious bar food. They have a full bar  and a huge variety of beer. The best part is their wall of self serve beer (charged by the ounce) that's both trendy and tech saavy. It's a little loud, as beer halls are, but they have a few game tables, like foosball, so it's a fun night. The food is bar food, but a step up, both in presentation and taste. I'll definitely come back and recommend giving it a shot if you're looking for a casual, trendy spot.

Stopped in for early dinner last weekend and the whole family had a great time. Our daughter loved playing the games.. we all loved our yummy food. Highly recommend the warm greens bowl w grilled salmon medium rare 👍🏼 and my husband loved his burger! The beer was very yummy as well. Will be back soon!
